description: Lenart Kova, facing mounting citywide frustration and infrastructure strain, quietly assesses ongoing BCI-related failures disrupting critical services.
Deciding stability outweighs the risk, Lenart carefully reactivates the BCI’s backup protocols for essential sectors, restoring automated routing for transit, hospitals, and water supply.
Basic city services resume, bringing citywide relief but also sparking suspicion—residents notice subtle, familiar patterns in service suggestions, reminiscent of the old BCI’s nudges.

Oksana Lintz discovers traces of a dormant protocol, leading her to consult with Rada Miskovic as rumors circulate and Council factions blame each other over the quiet return of algorithmic influence.

Mass protests erupt outside Council headquarters, with citizen assemblies demanding answers about shadow scoring and renewed algorithmic manipulation, fueling heated debates over trust and future governance.
